content.description:
You can see this crack from across the creek and it draws you in. Its not long, but its good climbing. There turns out to be two cracks once you get closer. This route starts at the base of an offwidth, then moves between the two cracks, and hand crack on the left and a fist crack on the right. Keep right for the finish.

You can sling a big rock and put in a couple nuts and/or cams to build an easy trad anchor for top rope once you get up there. You can scramble around the right very easily for a walk off, or for a TR if you don't feel like leading it..
content.protection: Gear to 3.5", possibly bigger if you have it. No anchor bolts. Gear anchor for TR.

content.description:
Not sure if this is a new FA or not, but we cleaned up the dirty crack at the bottom and to the right of "Leather Hand Lieback" enough to struggle up it and finished in the same gully as "Backstreet"

Its ~20 ft of semi awkward but solid crack climbing /stemming and is worthy of the effort.
content.location: Obvious crack in the left hand side of the nook near "Backstreet" and "You're the one".

content.description:
You start in the same off-width as "You're the one" but quickly head left up the other crack into some chossy hand jams, then traverse left into an obvious and fairly easy gully. I think this traverse is probably the crux of the climb.

The climbing isn't super hard, but the protection ins't great. I busted out several rounds of pebbles trying to get a cam in before it stuck. Will probably get better with traffic. Once you get left across the traverse its a cruiser.

There is a possibility to go straight up the crack using some harder 5.9? hand jam moves. Shout out if you can get it done.
content.protection: Gear to 3", Trad anchor for TR
content.location: Pretty much shares a start with "You're the one" but heads left after the first move.
